content.content: image830×897 112 KB  Feel happy to return to this important milestone for the protocol and its network in the ecosystem. We are back to 10 billion TLV funds, in the middle of a bear market, a great sign, we are still the most dominant DeFi protocol today. Source: makerburn.com
I always feel that TVL should be measured in ETH terms, if you do that then its not changed much. USD terms is just a wild ride

For me that screenshot evokes feelings of failure not feelings of celebration. 85.2% stablecoin backed. How defi is it really with all that central backing. -688,444 annual profits. People consider it wUSDC. The reputation hit is real. 2 Billion Dai that are minted with Eth are superior to 10 Billion Dai that are 90% stablecoin backed. The number 10 billion is absolutely meaningless. Is this real growth or is this cosmetics. Dai will have failed even if it wraps 100 Billion USDC from the perspective of a MKR holder if the annual profit is negative. Does the MKR price go up when Dai numbers go up? Does the market care that Dai wraps more USDC? I dont think anybody cares.

How is USDC a problem? Circle won’t freeze the USDC in the Maker contract, it would be suicide! Therefore everyone using DAI has all the benefits that USDC provides, plus they can’t have their funds frozen at the call of the FBI! I’d say that’s some pretty cool utility. Yes of course I want more DAI minted with ETH collateral but it’s still early days and the more stable ETH becomes, the more DAI will be backed by it.

Circle might have no choice if the US government intervenes. A court order is all that is necessary. The stablecoin backing makes Dai fragile against a regulatory attack. Also USDC Dai does not produce any income at all. Maker should figure out how to make the income producing Dai grow its not about the number of Dai its about the number of Dai that generate income for the protocol. I dont see what the plan is here? Increase Dai liquidity and then suddenly switch on the PSM fees and make it expensive to use the PSM ? If it continues like this it will lead to nowhere. From the point of view of a Dai user I dont have much of a problem with Dai (except the fragility against the US government concerns me) from the point of view of a Maker investor I am not satisfied with the outlook whatsoever. Ofcourse all the early lofty goals of having a crypto native stablecoin that is completly decentralized and autonomous went out of the window long ago.

Surviving this bear market that has caused many bankruptcies and liquidations while maintaining  DAIs peg is quite an accomplishment. Non Stablecoin lending is market driven and right now risky assets demand is low, not much we can do about it but continue to incentivize vault usage and L1/L2 integrations to open the gates to retail investors. However, lending innovation is required to keep up growth in this segment. Things such us AI lending based on users wallet usage, apps behaviours or other patterns might be needed or at least worth a try to support growth by lowering collateralization requirements while maintaining a high repayment ratio. In terms of revenue, the USDC backing will soon be returning yield back to MKR via off and on chain investments, the path to revenue is clear its just a matter of execution now.

The path is clear to generating revenue with USDC? Really? I remember this was discussed over 1 year ago already. And we are still at the same spot. Also generating it off chain will be another vulnerability. Because if Dai doesnt fit into the stablecoin framework the US government will put forth they can access the off chain assets anytime and put pressure on all people involved. Maybe it will open some people up to lawsuits. And MKR will be deemed a security. Whos assets will they legally be off chain? Can MakerDao keep legal control? And how is MKR then not a security? It gives voting rights its an investment contract and its vulnerable due to potentially having billions in US bonds. The path Maker is on it will need to comply with everything the US government demands. And its possible the entire business model of having eth collateral is not workable. Someone will have to register with the SEC too. Generating yield off chain with exposure to the US is going to potentially backfire big time. Defi is resilient because it keeps out of the reach of governments. And I honestly dont think Maker can comply with whats coming. I think it might turn out impossible.
All good questions, but right now the RWA is quite small so it’s not a systemic risk to MKR holders and the team are working on getting regulatory clarity.

They are working on regulatory clarity proves one thing the path is not clear to off chain yields through USDC. Its the opposite of clear its foggy and possibly cant be walked upon. Which is why currently there is no benefit in USDC Dai they might just aswell not exist as we cant generate any yield with them. And this is why reaching 10 Billion Dai is meaningless if its 90% stablecoin backed.

Ber10:  The path is clear to generating revenue with USDC? Really? I remember this was discussed over 1 year ago already. And we are still at the same spot.   This is objectively false. I haven’t been here for a year but we are much closer to investing PSM USDC in bonds than we were even a couple months ago.

Its not clear. There is tons of uncertainty and its not even clear that this is going to work. We might be closer to figuring it out than a year ago but we didnt move from the spot. Moving from the spot would mean generating yield. We are still at the same spot.
Ber10:  90% stablecoin backed   To be more precise, the support in stable is closer to 82.6%.

Yes I agree with you that the collateral that Dai backs could be used to generate interest as Aave will soon do with GHO, that will incentivize even more users to use Maker vaults and we would not be eaten by the competition.

Ber10:  We might be closer to figuring it out than a year ago but we didnt move from the spot. Moving from the spot would mean generating yield. We are still at the same spot.   Don’t think this is quite right - have a look at the following:     MIP65: Monetalis Clydesdale: Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution Archive   MIP65: Monetalis Clydesdale: Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution  Preamble MIP#: 65 Title: Monetalis Clydesdale: Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution Author(s): @Allan_Pedersen Contributors: Tags: Type: Proposal Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2022-02-09 Date Ratified: 2022-05-23 Dependencies: MIP21 Replaces: None Forum  URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip65-project-clydesdale-monetalis-arrangement-i-liquid-bond-strategy-execution/13148 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmXHM6…     You’ll see that MIP65 has already been passed and attention has since turned to specific asset allocation/implementation details: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmXedMr8#vote-breakdown  image1908×628 63 KB
Short term rates just got even higher making potential revenue from this even higher
